ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This course doesn't lend itself to this type of evaluation, but the EPC is incredibly well run and offers a hugely valuable opportunity for every student at FES. Everyone should take it at least once.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Josh provided excellent guidance to our group as we worked on our client project.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Working directly with clients on a project was a valuable experience and allowed us to help advance our client's goals in a tangible way.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course in order to work with a client and accomplish a project beyond the academic sphere.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Our group functioned well and was able to work effectively together and with the client. Experience working on non-academic projects with a team is useful for students.
helping each other out and learn from each other

Working in a group where the group members have different perceptions about workloads and required effort is challenging. A space in the clinic to somehow make sure that everyone is pulling their weight would be useful, though I'm not sure what that could look like.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: You should consider joining the clinic if there is a project you are interested in that will be relevant to your academic focus.
please do, a good learning experience, get to pick project
